Asif Nazrul Warns ICC: 'We Will Not Bow Down To Conditions Imposed At The Behest Of The BCCI'On this Special Report, the focus is on the escalating tension between Bangladesh and the International Cricket Council (ICC) regarding the upcoming T20 World Cup. Bangladesh Sports Advisor Asif Nazrul has issued a stern warning, stating that the nation 'will not bow down to any conditions imposed by the ICC at the behest of the BCCI.' The dispute centers on Bangladesh's refusal to play matches in India, citing security concerns and an 'anti-Bangladesh environment.' While speculation suggests the ICC might replace Bangladesh with Scotland, the Bangladesh interim government remains firm on its demand to move fixtures to Sri Lanka. The programme explores the potential impact on the tournament as a January 21 deadline approaches. India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy provides analysis on the back-pressure being created by the Bangladesh Cricket Board and the ICC's impending decision on the matter.
